:VGQH545: Mynewsdesk - Søk, overvåk, abonner på og publiser pressemeldinger Menu Close Prøv gratis Logg inn Søk i nyheter Priser Få en omvisning For journalister Om oss Kontakt Hjelp og support Logg inn Prøv gratis Kunde Bruksvilkår Content Vilkår for cookies Personvernerklæring Personvernerklæring for Contacts Datasikkerhet Databehandleravtale Tilgjengelighetserklæring Mynewsdesk Privacy Policy Contacts 2018 Version 2018-05-25 1. Introduction This Privacy Policy describes how your personal data is processed in Contacts, a service and feature on the platform provided by Mynewsdesk AB (we, us or our), corp. reg. no. 556634-1276, at the address Rosenlundsgatan 40, 118 53 Stockholm. Customers that use our website and services (Customers) can upload, collect and further process personal data of their contacts (you, your) when using our Contacts feature. Customers are responsible for and act as data controllers in relation to their processing of personal data in their use of Contacts. You may at any time contact us at support@mynewsdesk.com to receive information about which Customers that are currently processing your personal data in Contacts, including their contact information and (if applicable) contact information to their respective data protection officers. We are however also responsible for and act as data controller in relation to the processing of your personal data insofar as our capacity as provider of the Contacts feature on our platform gives us the opportunity to enable certain processing activities (subject to our terms and conditions) as further described below. We safeguard your personal integrity. It is therefore important for us to protect your personal data and to ensure that the processing of your personal data is correct and lawful. This Privacy Policy will help you to understand what kind of personal data about you that is collected and how it is processed in Contacts by our Customers as users of our platform and by us as platform provider, as well as your rights as a data subject. We ask that you read this Privacy Policy carefully and familiarize yourself with its content. We may sometimes need to make updates or changes to this Privacy Policy. If we do so, we will inform you in an appropriate manner and we ask you to then carefully read through the updated Privacy Policy. The date of the most recent update of this Privacy Policy is given at the top of the policy. We trust that this Privacy Policy answers your questions about the collection, use, protection and disclosure of your personal data in Contacts. If you have additional questions, please contact us at the address provided above or at support@mynewsdesk.com. 2. How is your personal data processed in Contacts? In this section, you can read about Contacts and the processing of personal data in the Contacts feature, including the purpose of the processing. We explain how your personal data is collected, the categories of personal data concerned, the processing activities involved, why we process your personal data as platform provider, with whom we share your personal data , including information regarding transfers of personal data outside the EU/EEA and the time period during which your personal data is stored in the Contacts platform. 2.1. About Contacts Contacts is a service and feature on our platform where our Customers may collect contact information and other information about their contacts in order to efficiently manage and distribute Content. Customers may collect such information by themselves uploading it and importing it into Contacts, or by using functions in the platform allowing them to collect information imported into Contacts by us, ourselves or via our third party suppliers, such as contact information to new contacts and further information about their contacts. Contacts allows Customers to create their own address lists for send-outs based on their collected information and to use functions to generate and further analyze information regarding their contacts’ interests and how their contacts interact with and respond to their messages. The purpose of Contacts is to facilitate and enable the procedure of managing and distributing commercial and non-commercial content (including marketing messages) based on the legitimate interest for our Customers to do so in accordance with applicable data protection law. For more information about Contacts, please visit https://help.mynewsdesk.com/en/how-to/introduction-to-contacts/. 2.2. How is your personal data collected in Contacts? Your personal data is imported into Contacts by: Customers uploading your contact information and other information about you to Contacts (such information is only accessed via their user accounts); or us providing your contact information and other information about you to Contacts, ourselves or via our third party suppliers, such information having been published by you or others in publicly accessible sources such as social media and other media channels online, and researched and collected by us or our third party suppliers. 2.3. Which personal data is processed in Contacts? The categories of personal data processed in Contacts are the following: Name and contact details such as your address, email address, telephone number and fax number; Nationality, country and other location information; Professional title and company name; Information regarding you and your interests as published by you or others on publicly accessible sources, such as social media and other media channels online, for example on your profile on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook or other information platforms; and Information about your interaction with emails sent to you via the email function in Contacts. 2.4. How is your personal data processed in Contacts? Your personal data will only be processed for the following activities in Contacts. Search function: Making articles and other items that have been published online and which contain information about you easy to find; Address lists function: Adding your contact information and other information about you to address lists in Contacts in order to manage and distribute content to you; Email function: Distributing content to you; Following-up on and analyzing your personal interests with digital analyzing tools in order to choose relevant content based on your personal interests, including data generated from your interaction with emails sent to you via the email function in Contacts. To opt-out from processing under this section (d), please opt-out here: https://www.mynewsdesk.com/audience_reach_opt_outs/new 2.5. Why we process your personal data as provider of the Contacts feature In this subsection, we describe when and why we process your personal data. Your personal data will not be used by us in any manner that is incompatible with the purposes for which they were collected. 2.5.1. Provide our services We process your personal data to provide the Contacts service and feature on our platform. Our processing for the purpose of providing our services is based on our legitimate interest to do so in order to facilitate and enable our Customers’ procedure of managing and distributing commercial and non-commercial content as described in section 2.1 above. 2.5.2. Improve our services We process your personal data to improve our services and make them more user friendly (e.g. by testing and troubleshooting, fixing bugs and amending our interfaces). This includes producing statistics on and analyzing how our services are used. For these purposes, we also use your personal data based on your activity associated with messages sent to you by our Customers.To the extent possible, we use your personal data in an aggregated or anonymized form in this processing. Our processing for the purpose of improving our services is based on our legitimate interest to do so. 2.6. How we share your personal data as provider of the Contacts feature The personal data collected in Contacts is shared with our Customers for their use of Contacts as explained in this Privacy Policy. In addition to this, the personal data collected in Contacts is shared with other companies in the Mynewsdesk group as well as with our third party suppliers and other third parties listed below, for the provision of our services such as theContacts feature, including for our developing and maintenance of the platform. This may involve coordination of your personal data with other registers. These are the types of third parties with whom we share your personal data: Service providers: We use third party service providers to manage some aspects of our business operations, including the processing or handling of personal data related to Contacts. We share personal data related to Contacts with such third parties with regard to IT infrastructure, operating and hosting services and other IT services such as IT support, maintenance and development. Sale or transfer of business or assets: Your personal data may, to the extent allowed and in accordance with applicable data protection law, be transferred or disclosed to a purchaser or prospective purchaser in the event of a sale, assignment, or other transfer of all or a portion of our business or assets. For security reasons: We may share your personal data when this is required by law, to protect you or our Customers or for the security of our services. When we use service providers in accordance with (a) above, we will enter into a data processing agreement with the service provider which requires it to ensure that your personal data is only processed in accordance with our instructions and take other appropriate measures to ensure that your personal data is processed in accordance with this Privacy Policy.Processing and sharing of your personal data in accordance with (a)-(c) above is necessary for our legitimate interest to provide our services, including Contacts or to comply with mandatory law. 2.7. Transfer of your personal data outside the EU/EEA When another company in the Mynewsdesk group, our service providers, other suppliers or any potential purchaser of our business or assets are located in or have business activities in a country outside the EU/EEA, we may transfer your personal data to such countries. In the event of such transfer it will be made in accordance with applicable data protection law, for example by ensuring that the country in which the recipient is located ensures an adequate level of data protection according to the European Commission or by use of standard contractual clauses that the European Commission has issued ensuring suitable measures to safeguard your rights and freedoms. You may access a list of the countries that the European Commission has decided provide an adequate level of data protection at https://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/international-transfers/adequacy/index_en.htm. You may access the European Commission’s standard contractual clauses at https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/dec/2010/87/oj. 2.8. For how long do we store your personal data? Your personal data will only be processed in Contacts for as long as necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy and to fulfill our legal duties to store data otherwise, but no longer than permitted by applicable law. We have routines in place to remove personal data that is no longer necessary or allowed to store, including of due to termination of the agreements between us and our Customers or where you have opted-out from processing in Contacts. See section 4.5 below to learn more about your right to opt-out. 3. Security measures We have taken a number of security measures to ensure that the personal data we keep in Contacts is secure. For example, access to areas where personal data is stored is limited to our employees and service providers who require it in the course of their duties and who are informed of the importance of maintaining the security and confidentiality of the personal data we keep. We maintain appropriate safeguards and security standards to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, disclosure or misuse. We also monitor our systems to discover vulnerabilities in order to protect your personal data. 4. Your rights 4.1. Introduction In this section, we describe your rights under applicable data protection law as well as how you exercise these rights. As described in section 1, our Customers are responsible for and act as data controllers in relation to their processing of personal data in their use of Contacts. We are responsible for and act as data controllers insofar as our capacity as provider of the Contacts feature on our platform gives us the opportunity to enable certain processing activities (subject to our terms and conditions), but otherwise only act as data processor on behalf of our Customers with regard to their processing of personal data within Contacts. You may exercise your rights in relation to the processing of personal data within Contacts regardless of whether your right concerns the processing of our Customers or our processing. According to our customer agreements both we and our Customers shall ensure compliance with applicable data protection law and thereby respect your rights as a data subject in relation to the processing activities in Contacts. Against this background, and as a part of our service to our Customers, we help facilitate for our Customers to fulfil their obligations in relation to your rights. We thus inform in this Privacy Policy about our Customers’ processing of personal data within Contacts and our platform includes functions allowing you to exercise your rights, as further described below. Furthermore, you may at all times contact us at support@mynewsdesk.com to exercise your rights as below, as well as if you have any questions or comments regarding the processing of your personal data in Contacts or this Privacy Policy. We will respond within a reasonable period of time upon verification of your identity. Should your question or request be related to the processing of personal data by one or more of our Customers and our tools not be sufficient to ensure that your rights are ensured, we will forward your question or request to the relevant Customer processing your personal data, for their further handling and inform you accordingly. 4.2. Right of access and rectification You have the right to information regarding which of your personal data that is processed in Contacts and to access and rectify such personal data. 4.3. Right to erasure You may request that your personal data is erased from Contacts without undue delay in the following circumstances: the personal data is no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected or otherwise processed; you withdraw your consent on which the processing is based (if applicable) and there is no other legal ground for the processing; you object to the processing of personal data and we or our Customers do not have any overriding legitimate grounds for the processing; the processed personal data is unlawfully processed; or the processed personal data has to be erased for compliance with legal obligations. 4.4. Right to restriction Your request may be denied if erasing your personal data is prevented by requirements set out in applicable laws and regulations or if they are needed for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims. If your request cannot be met with reference to such circumstances, we will, unless prevented in relation to our agreements with our Customers, restrict the processing of your personal data to the purpose that prevents the erasure. You have the right to restrict the processing of your personal data in Contacts under the following circumstances: you contest the accuracy of the personal data during a period enabling us or our Customers to verify the accuracy of such data; the processing is unlawful and you oppose erasure of the personal data and request restriction instead; the personal data is no longer needed for the purposes of the processing, but are necessary for you for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims; you have objected to the processing of the personal datain accordance with section 4.5 below, pending the verification whether legitimate grounds for the processing override your interests, rights and freedoms. If your personal data has been restricted in accordance with this section they may, with exception of storage, only be processed for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims, or for the protection of the rights of a third party or for reasons of important public interest according to EU or EU member state legislation. 4.5. Right to object to further processing You may at any time exercise your right to opt-out from any further processing of your personal data in Contacts by one or more of our specific Customers by using the dashboard for privacy settings available at https://www.mynewsdesk.com/contact_subscriptions. If you opt-out using the dashboard you will not receive any further send-outs via Contacts from the Customers that you have chosen to opt-out in relation to, and your personal data will not be further processed in Contacts by these Customers. You may also at any time exercise your right to generally opt-out from the processing of your personal data in Contacts by contacting us at support@mynewsdesk.com. If you exercise your right to generally opt-out from such processing you will not receive any further send-outs via Contacts from any of our Customers and your personal data will not be further processed in Contacts, except forthe purpose of ensuring that your choice to opt-out is respected (by registering your email address in order to identify you as blocked from being subject to further processing – please note that further processing of your personal data may still occur if you use more than one email address). 4.6. Right to data portability If your personal data in Contacts has been provided by you and the processing of your personal data is based on your consent or on the performance of a contract with you, you have the right to receive the personal data concerning you in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format in order to transmit these to another service provider where it would be technically feasible and can be carried out by automated means. 4.7. Right to withdraw consent When the processing of your personal data in Contacts is based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. Please note that the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal is not affected. 4.8. Right to file a complaint You may at any time lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority if you believe that the processing of your personal data in Contacts is performed in breach of applicable data protection law. Please note that you are also always welcome to contact us in such event. www.mynewsdesk.com/de-de/ueber-mynewsdes: :VGQH545: Über uns | Mynewsdesk Über Mynewsdesk Darum Mynewsdesk Funktionsweise KI optimierte PR Partnerprogramm Kundenfeedback Vision und Werte Das Team Datenschutz Karriere Unsere PR-Software Pressemitteilungen Presseverteiler Medienbeobachtung Digitaler Newsroom Internationale PR CoPilot Preise Mehr entdecken Blog Ebooks, Templates und Guides Events & Webinare Newsletter-Anmeldung Testen Sie unsere KI Deutsch Deutsch Dansk English Norsk Svenska Einloggen Demo buchen Kostenfrei testen Start / Über uns Über uns Mynewsdesk wurde 2003 von einem Journalisten, einem Kommunikationsexperten und einem Entwickler in Stockholm gegründet. Deren Vision war es, die Arbeit von PR-Agenturen, PR-Leuten auf Unternehmensseite und von Journalisten von Grund auf zu reformieren und deren Prozesse und den Austausch untereinander zu digitalisieren. Seitdem hat sich Mynewsdesk zum skandinavischen Marktprimus, zum weltweiten Technologieführer und zum einzige Anbieter einer vollständig KI-gestützten PR-Software entwickelt. Kontaktieren Sie uns PR-SaaS Unsere weltweit 150 Mitarbeiter haben mit einem tiefen und über Jahre gewachsenen Verständnis von PR, Kommunikation und Marketing eine Plattform entwickelt, über die Unternehmen Content wie Pressemitteilungen oder Blogbeiträge kreieren, Zielgruppen recherchieren und Verteiler digital erstellen, das Aussenden von Content steuern, die Berichterstattung analysieren und die Stimmung und Wahrnehmung von Marken und Botschaften beispielsweise in traditionellen Medien oder in Social Media und Blogs auswerten. Die Plattform wendet sich an Unternehmen beliebiger Größe und steht als Software as a Service (SaaS) zur Verfügung. Mithilfe von Künstlicher Intelligenz unterstützen wir Unternehmen bei der Content-Produktion und beim Erstellen von Verteilern und helfen damit Organisationen, über relevante Inhalte ihre Bekanntheit zu steigern und Beziehungen zu unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern aufzubauen und zu pflegen. Seit 2008 gehört Mynewsdesk zur norwegischen Mediengruppe NHST. Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams! Mynewsdesk bietet Ihnen einen Arbeitsplatz, der Ihre Talente fördert. Bei uns können Sie sich weiterentwickeln – sowohl beruflich als auch persönlich. Wir sind ein stark wachsendes Unternehmen und suchen Mitarbeiter, die beim Aufbau einer der führenden PR-Plattformen teilhaben wollen. Erfahren Sie mehr über die Mitarbeiter von Mynewsdesk und sehen Sie sich auf unserer Career-Seite unsere offenen Stellen an. Separate terms and conditions apply for Mynewsdesk’s publishing platform. 1. The Services Mynewsdesk provides Services including text, photograph and film production or any other specifically agreed service on the basis of these Terms. All Mynewsdesk’s delivery times assume that the Customer participates in meetings and provides requested material in a reasonable time. If the Customer neglects its commitments in this area, Mynewsdesk is entitled to extend the agreed delivery times. Mynewsdesk reserves the right to use all or part of the supplied product in its own channels (e.g. website, social media, showcase) to market Mynewsdesk’s Services. For the production of materials within each Service, the following applies: TEXT PRODUCTION The Customer undertakes to specify what it wishes the ordered text to communicate in a format to be agreed between the parties. A text is only considered ordered once a digital brief has been completed and the Customer has received a confirmation email that Mynewsdesk has received the order. If the brief is considered inadequate, Mynewsdesk will contact the Customer for completion. Once the assignment has been specified, the Customer is to supply Mynewsdesk with the necessary information and materials continuously and in a timely manner to enable the assignment to be completed in accordance with the assignment specification and the agreed timeframe. In order for the agreed timeframe to be met, the Customer must provide an interviewee during the initial two (2) days of the assignment and assist the author with the documentation and information necessary to produce the text. Mynewsdesk undertakes to deliver a first draft text within ten (10) working days of receiving and approving the digital brief. Unless otherwise agreed, the text supplied by Mynewsdesk will be limited to a maximum of 2500 characters. Each text production includes two (2) rounds of proofing, unless otherwise agreed. When a text is sent to the Customer for proofing, the Customer has one (1) calendar week to come back with comments on the delivered text. Mynewsdesk will rework the text according to the Customer’s requirements and deliver a new draft text within three (3) working days. The Customer then has one (1) additional calendar week to return with final comments after which Mynewsdesk will finalise the text in three (3) working days. If further comments are not submitted during the second round of proofing, the text shall thereby be deemed to be delivered and approved. The Customer is responsible for the approval of content and quotations by external parties. If the Customer requires further rounds of proofing, this will be done on a running account basis based on Mynewdesk’s currently applicable price list. Delivered text is saved by Mynewsdesk for twelve (12) months. TRANSLATION The Customer is to provide Mynewsdesk with text in a document in an agreed editable format. A standard translation is limited to a maximum of 2500 characters. Mynewsdesk delivers a translated text within three (3) working days of receiving the text from the Customer. Proofing is not included. Delivered text is saved by Mynewsdesk for twelve (12) months. If the Customer wants express delivery, the Customer may have the translation delivered within 24 hours of ordering. For express delivery, the Customer will be charged double the fee for the translation. Ordered translations are always carried out by an authorised translator or professional translator. STILL IMAGE PRODUCTION When ordering a photo assignment, the parties shall agree before the photo session on setting, props and other content to be conveyed by the images. Still images shall be delivered no later than ten (10) working days after the photo session, unless otherwise agreed. Following completion of the photo opportunity, a number of test images will be sent to the Customer for retouching approval with regard to colour and shape. The Customer has two (2) working days to come back with comments and proposed adjustments to the delivered material with regard to colour and shape. Mynewsdesk will then rework the image material in accordance with the Customer’s wishes and deliver a final version within ten (10) working days. If comments are not submitted within the specified two (2) working days, the image material shall be deemed to be delivered and approved. If the Customer requires further rounds of proofing, this will be done on a running account basis based on Mynewdesk’s currently applicable price list. Production materials, negatives, raw images, masters or original files remain the property of Mynewsdesk unless otherwise agreed in writing. The Customer is entitled to buy out such material according to a separate agreement. The Customer owns the rights to the final product, including, where appropriate, music tracks, still images, licensed stock images and video clips, but may only publish the final version on multiple channels. The right of publication is unlimited in terms of time. Mynewsdesk refrains from asserting their moral rights to the product. Granting of delivered products to third parties is not permitted. Working versions produced during the assignment may not be published. The Customer may not modify or make its own versions of the final production. The number of photographs supplied is limited to the number specified in the relevant still images package. Photographs are delivered as high-resolution JPEG. For social media and the web, photographs are delivered as lower resolution JPEG unless otherwise agreed. The final product delivered will be saved by Mynewsdesk for twenty-four (24) months. The Customer owns delivered photographs and may publish them in multiple channels for an unlimited time. The Customer may only use the photographs in the Customer’s own activities and channels. FILM PRODUCTION The Customer undertakes to specify what it wishes the ordered film to communicate in a format to be agreed between the parties. The scope of the ordered film production is in accordance with the film package ordered by the Customer. Once the assignment has been specified, the Customer is to supply Mynewsdesk with the necessary information and materials continuously and in a timely manner to enable the assignment to be completed in accordance with the assignment specification and the agreed timeframe. Each film production includes, unless otherwise agreed, two (2) rounds of proofing for produced film material. When material for film production is sent to the Customer for proofing, the Customer has two (2) calendar weeks to return with comments and proposed adjustments to the delivered material. Mynewsdesk will rework the material according to the Customer’s requirements and deliver a new draft within two (2) working weeks. The Customer then has two (2) calendar weeks to return with final comments, after which Mynewsdesk undertakes to deliver a final version within two (2) working weeks. If further comments are not submitted by the Customer during the second round of proofing, the material shall be deemed to be delivered and approved. If the Customer requires further rounds of proofing, this will be done on a running account basis based on Mynewdesk’s currently applicable price list. Production materials, negatives, masters or original files remain the property of Mynewsdesk unless otherwise agreed in writing. The Customer is entitled to buy out such material according to a separate agreement. In productions where the Customer provides Mynewsdesk with material, Mynewsdesk has no rights to use such material in other productions without the Customer’s consent. The Customer guarantees that it holds all necessary rights to the material submitted to Mynewsdesk in order to be part of the film production. The Customer owns the final product and may publish the final version on multiple channels for an unlimited time. Working versions produced during the assignment may not be published. The Customer may not modify or make its own versions of the final production. Granting of delivered products to third parties is not permitted. Mynewsdesk saves the raw material for 18 months. Material that has been delivered from material is saved for six (6) months. The final product delivered will be saved by Mynewsdesk for twelve (12) months. CONTENT STRATEGY WITH WORKSHOP Mynewsdesk will lead a workshop on content strategy for marketing of relevant content with participants from the Customer. Following completion of the workshop, Mynewsdesk will deliver a plan for the Customer’s content strategy within three (3) calendar weeks. The Customer receives the rights to the delivered plan and is responsible for adaptations of the plan and how it wishes to implement the strategy. 2. The Customer’s business area Mynewsdesk does not undertake assignments from companies, associations or organisations active in the tobacco, gambling and weapons industries. Mynewsdesk never undertakes assignments in which the content may be perceived as threatening, harassing, vulgar, defamatory, harmful, offensive or illegal. If the parties have signed an agreement on completion of an assignment and the conditions for the assignment change during production, meaning that it may be perceived in a manner stated above, Mynewsdesk is entitled to discontinue the assignment immediately at its own discretion. The project will then be invoiced at full price as per the agreement entered into. 3. The Customer’s responsibility for content The Customer is responsible for ensuring that all communication of the content in the delivered Services is provided in accordance with applicable legislation, official decisions, industry practices and recommendations, as well as these Terms. The Customer shall indemnify Mynewsdesk from all claims that may be directed against Mynewsdesk as a result of the Customer’s handling of the content of the delivered Services. Even for agreements where a publishing service is included, it is the Customer who bears responsibility for the content published. 4. Prices and payment terms The order states the amount that is to be paid for the agreed services. The payment is due when the content order is placed. All prices set are excluded from statutory VAT. The payment is processed according to the issued invoice. In the case of retainer agreements, the invoices are to be paid monthly, regardless if the hours have been used during the current month or not. However, the customer obtains the option to save an unused retainer sum for up to six months. Payment terms are 30 days net. Default interest is paid in accordance with the Swedish Interest Act. 5. Contract period Film, photo and text packages which contain more than eight (8) texts must be used within 12 months after signed contract. After 12 months the contract expires, meaning you can no longer use the remaining package, unless there is an agreement made between both parties that states differently. If a customer has purchased 1-6 texts, 1 month applies for 1 text (for example 3 texts apply to 3 months). 6. Content training The Customer’s cancellation of ordered training must be submitted in writing to Mynewsdesk no later than 48 hours before the training is due to take place. If the cancellation is submitted less than 48 hours beforehand, the Customer will be charged 50 per cent of the agreed full price. 7. Limitation of liability Mynewsdesk’s liability is limited to direct damages. Mynewsdesk’s total liability for compensation in a calendar year is also limited to the amount paid by the Customer to Mynewsdesk for the Services during the same calendar year. 8. Confidentiality Mynewsdesk undertakes to keep information that could be considered the Customer’s business or trade secrets confidential, unless the Customer gives its written consent otherwise. This means that Mynewsdesk may not disclose such information to third parties or use such information for any purpose other than to complete delivery of the Services. The confidentiality commitment is valid for two years after each assignment agreement ends. Confidentiality does not apply to any information that Mynewsdesk becomes aware of in any way other than the information having been received within the framework of the agreement between the Customer and Mynewsdesk, or which was already generally known. Nor does the duty of confidentiality apply if Mynewsdesk is obliged to reveal such information by law, statute or official decision. 9. Force Majeure Mynewsdesk is not responsible for delays, errors or omissions if caused by circumstances beyond Mynewsdesk’s control and that cause obstruction, delay or complication of fulfilment of Mynewsdesk’s commitments in connection with the provision of the Services. 10. Disputes Any disputes arising from these Terms and agreed Services shall be interpreted and applied in accordance with Swedish law. Disputes shall be settled by the ordinary courts with Stockholm District Court as the first instance. 11. Processing of personal data Mynewsdesk’s processing of personal data as the controller is described in the Mynewsdesk Privacy Policy: https://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/about/terms-and-conditions/privacy_policy. Innledning Denne personvernerklæringen beskriver hvordan Mynewsdesk AB (vi, oss, vår, vårt eller våre), org.nr. 556634-1276, på adresse Rosenlundsgatan 40, 118 53 Stockholm, Sverige håndterer personopplysninger. Brukere av nettstedet og tjenestene våre (du, din, ditt eller dine) kan oppgi personopplysninger til oss når de besøker nettstedet og bruker tjenestene våre. Du kan gjøre dette i egenskap av privatperson eller representant for et selskap. Vi kan også få dine personopplysninger fra tredjeparter. Vi opptrer som behandlingsansvarlig for slike innhentede personopplysninger og behandling av disse i henhold til denne personvernerklæringen. Vi ivaretar din personlige integritet. Det er derfor viktig for oss å beskytte personopplysningene dine og sikre at vår behandling av dem er korrekt og lovlig. Denne personvernerklæringen vil hjelpe deg med å forstå hvilke personopplysninger vi innhenter og hvordan de blir brukt når du besøker nettstedet og bruker tjenestene våre, samt hvilke rettigheter du har som registrert. Du kan utøve rettighetene dine ved å ta kontakt med support@mynewsdesk.com. Vi ber deg leser grundig gjennom denne personvernerklæringen og gjøre deg kjent med innholdet ettersom den gjelder all bruk av nettstedet og tjenestene våre, uavhengig av hvem du er og hvilket forhold vi har til deg. Merk at hvis du velger å følge et nyhetsrom, vil du, i tillegg til behandlingen som er beskrevet i denne personvernerklæringen, være underlagt behandling som beskrevet i vår personvernerklæring for kontakter. Vi vil av og til ha behov for å endre eller oppdatere denne personvernerklæringen. Hvis det skjer, vil vi informere deg på korrekt måte og be deg om å lese nøye gjennom den oppdaterte personvernerklæringen. Dato for den nyeste oppdateringen av personvernerklæringen står øverst i erklæringen. Vi håper at denne personvernerklæringen gir svar på spørsmål du måtte ha om innhenting, bruk, beskyttelse og spredning av personopplysningene dine. Skulle du ha andre spørsmål, kan du kontakte oss på adressen som er oppgitt ovenfor eller på support@mynewsdesk.com. 2. Hvordan behandler vi personopplysningene dine? I denne delen kan du lese mer om hvilke personopplysninger vi behandler og hvorfor, hvordan opplysningene innhentes, hvilke behandlingsaktiviteter som er involvert, hvem vi deler opplysningene med, inklusive informasjon om overføring av personopplysninger til land utenfor EU/EØS samt hvor lenge vi lagrer opplysningene dine. 2.1. Hvilke personopplysninger behandler vi? Vi behandler følgende kategorier av personopplysninger: Navn og kontaktopplysninger, som for eksempel e-postadresse, telefonnummer, lokalisering, yrkestittel og informasjon vedrørende selskapet du representerer samt eventuelle andre avtaler du har inngått med oss på vegne av deg selv eller selskapet ditt Kontoopplysninger, inklusive brukernavn/bruker-ID, navn på nyhetsrom, passord, informasjon vedrørende unike identifikatorer som API-tokens, profilbilde, biometri og informasjon relatert til andre sosiale medier-profiler (f.eks. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Skype og Google-kontoer) som du har koblet til brukerkontoen din Personlige og profesjonelle preferanser, inklusive interesser, abonnementer og språkinnstillinger Informasjon om nettleser, f.eks. type og versjon, eventuelle nettsider du har blitt overført fra, hvilken tidssone du befinner deg i når du besøker oss, hvilke sider du besøker på nettstedet vårt, IP-adresse og en omtrentlig lokalisering basert på IP-adressen, informasjon om din nettaktivitet eller din interaksjon i e-poster vi sender deg, informasjon om bruken din av tjenestene våre 2.2. Hvorfor behandler vi personopplysningene dine? I dette punktet beskriver vi når og hvorfor vi behandler personopplysningene dine. Personopplysningene dine vil ikke bli brukt på noen måter som er uforenlig med formålene de er innhentet for. 2.2.1. Levere tjenester Vi behandler personopplysningene dine for å levere deg eller selskapet ditt våre tjenester og for å kommunisere med deg. Dette inkluderer å gi deg tilgang til ulike funksjoner, administrere kontoen din, behandle kontoinformasjonen din i forbindelse med inngåelse eller gjennomføring av en avtale med deg eller selskapet ditt, sende faktura til selskapet ditt og levere support, opplæring, profesjonelle tjenester og generell informasjon om tjenestene våre. Vår behandling med formål om å levere tjenestene våre er basert på vår berettigede interesse eller på ditt tidligere samtykke (der det er aktuelt, som for eksempel når du oppretter en konto). 2.2.2. Forbedre tjenestene våre Vi behandler personopplysningene dine for å forbedre tjenestene våre og gjøre dem mer brukervennlige (f.eks. ved testing og feilsøking, ved å korrigere feil og justere grensesnittet, slik at det blir enklere for deg å finne informasjonen du leter etter eller for å fremheve populære funksjoner). Dette innbefatter å utarbeide statistikker og analysere hvordan du bruker tjenestene våre samt gjennomføre markedsundersøkelser og kundetilfredshetsundersøkelser, i tillegg til å få tilbakemelding fra deg via andre tilbakemeldingsfunksjoner. For disse formålene bruker vi også personopplysningene dine basert på din nettaktivitet og aktivitet knyttet til e-poster vi sender deg, inklusive hvordan du bruker nettstedet og tjenestene våre, dine interesser, din yrkestittel og selskap samt andre likheter med andre brukeres interesser og brukermønstre (såkalt profilering og segmentering). Så langt det er mulig bruker vi personopplysningene dine i en samlet eller anonymisert form i denne behandlingen. Behandlingen, som har som formål å forbedre tjenestene våre, er basert på vår berettigede interesse. 2.2.3. Direkte markedsføring Vi bruker også personopplysningene dine til å kommunisere med deg om tjenestene våre, informere deg om våre vilkår og betingelser og til å sende deg markedsføringsmeldinger. Imidlertid vil du kun motta markedsføringsmeldinger dersom du har godkjent dette via dobbelt samtykke-prosedyren (i den grad en slik fremgangsmåte er påkrevd ved gjeldende lov). Du kan når som helst velge å reservere deg mot ytterligere markedsføringsmeldinger ved å bruke lenken for avslutning av abonnement som finnes i alle markedsføringsmeldinger. Vår behandling i forbindelse med direkte markedsføring er basert på vår berettigede interesse for å promotere tjenestene våre, eller på ditt tidligere samtykke (som når du sier ja til å motta markedsføringsmeldinger, eller når du velger å følge et nyhetsrom). 2.3. Hvordan innhenter vi personopplysningene dine? Vi henter inn personopplysningene dine når du registrer en brukerkonto eller på annen måte oppgir personopplysningene dine. Vi henter også inn personopplysningene dine på grunnlag av din nettaktivitet og aktiviteter i e-poster vi sender deg, inklusive hvordan du bruker nettstedet og tjenestene våre, samt fra tredjeparter. Når det gjelder innsamling av personopplysninger via informasjonskapsler (cookies), henviser vi til vår cookie-policy. 2.4. Hvordan deler vi personopplysningene dine? Personopplysningene vi samler inn blir delt med andre selskaper i Mynewsdesk-konsernet og med tredjeparts-leverandører og andre tredjeparter listet opp nedenfor, for å kunne levere tjenestene våre, inklusive utvikling og vedlikehold av plattformen. Dette kan omfatte koordinering av personopplysningene dine med andre registre. Nedenfor følger en liste over typer tredjeparter vi deler personopplysningene dine med: Tjenesteleverandører: Vi bruker tredjepartsleverandører for å håndtere enkelte aspekter ved forretningsdriften vår. Vi deler personopplysninger med slike tredjeparter med hensyn til IT-infrastruktur, drifts- og hosting-tjenester, markedsundersøkelser og kommunikasjon, finans- og betalingstjenester, kundetjenester og IT-tjenester, som for eksempel IT-support, vedlikehold og utvikling. Partnere: Dersom du bruker tjenester som leveres av våre partnere, og som er integrert med våre tjenester, vil våre partnere få tilgang til personopplysningene dine. Personopplysningene som samles inn av våre partnere, omfattes av deres egne vilkår og retningslinjer for behandling av personopplysninger. Salg eller overføring av virksomhet eller ressurser: I den grad det er tillatt og i samsvar med gjeldende personvernlovgivning kan personopplysningene dine bli overført eller oppgitt til en kjøper eller potensiell kjøper i forbindelse med et salg, oppdrag eller annen overføring av alle eller deler av vår virksomhet eller ressurser. Personer i nettverket ditt og allmennheten generelt. Dersom du velger å publisere personopplysningene dine når du bruker tjenestene våre, for eksempel ved å laste opp innhold eller legge inn innlegg i andres kommentarfelt, gjør du denne informasjonen synlig for allmennheten. Hvis e-postadressen din brukes til å sende nyhetsmeldinger, vil e-postadressen være synlig for mottakerne av nyhetsmeldingene. Våre kunder: Når du besøker et nyhetsrom, deler vi din omtrentlige lokalisering med kundene våre. Av sikkerhetsgrunner: Vi kan dele personopplysningene dine dersom det er påkrevd ved lov, eller for å beskytte deg, kundene våre eller sikkerheten til tjenestene våre. Når vi bruker tjenesteleverandører i henhold til (a) ovenfor, vil vi inngå en avtale om behandling av personopplysninger med tjenesteleverandøren, som sikrer at personopplysningene dine kun behandles i tråd med våre instrukser og denne personvernerklæringen. Behandling og deling av personopplysningene dine i henhold til (a)–(e) ovenfor er nødvendig for vår berettigede interesse i å levere våre tjenester eller oppfylle eventuell kontrakt vi har inngått med deg eller ditt selskap, eller i å overholde forpliktelser i henhold til lov. 2.5. Overføring av personopplysningene dine til land utenfor EU/EØS Når et annet selskap i Mynewsdesk-konsernet, våre serviceleverandører, partnere eller andre potensielle kjøpere av vår virksomhet eller ressurser, er lokalisert i eller virksomme i et land utenfor EU/EØS, kan vi overføre personopplysningene dine til slike land. En slik eventuell overføring vil skje i tråd med gjeldende personvernregelverk, for eksempel ved å sikre at landet mottakeren befinner seg i, sørger for tilstrekkelig beskyttelsesnivå i henhold til EU-kommisjonen eller ved bruk av standard kontraktsvilkår utstedt av EU-kommisjonen, som sikrer hensiktsmessige tiltak for å ivareta dine rettigheter og friheter. Du finner en liste over de landene som Europakommisjonen har besluttet har tilstrekkelig beskyttelsesnivå på https://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/international-transfers/adequacy/index_en.htm. Du finner EU-kommisjonens standard kontraktsvilkår på https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/dec/2010/87/oj. 2.6. Hvor lenge lagrer vi personopplysningene dine? Vi vil kun lagre personopplysningene dine så lenge det er nødvendig for det formålet de ble innhentet for, og for å oppfylle lovkrav om lagring av personopplysninger, men ikke lenger enn det som er tillatt etter gjeldende lov. Vi har rutiner som fjerner personopplysninger som ikke lenger er nødvendige, eller som vi ikke lenger har lov til å lagre, inklusive årlig fjerning av personopplysninger relatert til slettede kontoer. 3. Sikkerhetstiltak Vi har truffet en rekke sikkerhetstiltak for å sikre at personopplysningene vi oppbevarer er trygge. For eksempel er adgang til lagringsområder for personopplysninger begrenset til våre ansatte og tjenesteleverandører som trenger tilgang på grunn av sine arbeidsoppgaver, og som er informert om viktigheten av å ivareta sikkerhet og konfidensialitet med tanke på personopplysningene vi oppbevarer. Vi sørger for hensiktsmessige beskyttelsestiltak og sikkerhetsstandarder som beskytter personopplysningene dine mot uautorisert tilgang, spredning eller misbruk. I tillegg overvåker vi systemene for å oppdage eventuelle sårbarheter og sørge for at personopplysningene dine er beskyttet. 4. Dine rettigheter 4.1. Rett til å protestere Du har allmenn rett til å protestere mot vår behandling av personopplysningene dine når behandlingen er basert på vår berettigede interesse. Dersom du protesterer, og vi mener at vi likevel kan behandle personopplysningene dine, må vi påvise at det foreligger tvingende, berettigede grunner for behandlingen som går foran dine interesser, rettigheter og friheter, eller for å fastsette, gjøre gjeldende eller forsvare rettskrav. Personopplysningene dine vil ikke bli behandlet for formål knyttet til direkte markedsføring dersom du motsetter deg slik behandling. 4.6. Rett til dataportabilitet Dersom du har oppgitt personopplysningene dine selv og vår behandling av opplysningene er basert på samtykke fra eller kontrakt med deg, har du rett til å få utlevert personopplysningene i et strukturert, vanlig brukt og maskinlesbart format, slik at de kan overføres direkte til en annen tjenesteleverandør når dette er teknisk mulig og kan utføres automatisk. 4.7. Rett til å trekke tilbake samtykke Når vår behandling av personopplysninger er basert på samtykke, har du til enhver tid rett til å trekke tilbake samtykket. Du kan trekke tilbake samtykket ved å gå til kontoinnstillingene og slette kontoen din. Merk at lovligheten av behandling som bygger på samtykke før samtykket trekkes tilbake, ikke påvirkes. 4.8. Rett til å sende inn klage Du kan til enhver tid sende inn klage til tilsynsmyndigheten (Datatilsynet) dersom du mener at vår behandling bryter med gjeldende personvernregelverk. Merk at du i slike tilfeller alltid er velkommen til å kontakte oss. www.mynewsdesk.com/se/about/terms-and-co: :VGQH545: Mynewsdesk - Søk, overvåk, abonner på og publiser pressemeldinger Menu Close Prøv gratis Logg inn Søk i nyheter Priser Få en omvisning For journalister Om oss Kontakt Hjelp og support Logg inn Prøv gratis Kunde Bruksvilkår Content Vilkår for cookies Personvernerklæring Personvernerklæring for Contacts Datasikkerhet Databehandleravtale Tilgjengelighetserklæring Retningslinjer for Cookies Vi bruker cookies (informasjonskapsler) på nettsiden vår. Cookies er små tekstfiler som er lagret på din datamaskin. I Retningslinjer for Cookies viser vi hvilke cookies vi bruker, hvorfor vi bruker dem og hvordan du kan forhindre bruken. Hvilke typer cookies bruker Mynewsdesk? Vi bruker to typer cookies på nettsiden vår. Den første typen er en vedvarende cookie som forblir på datamaskinen din i en forhåndsbestemt periode, og har en utløpsdato. Denne typen cookies blir brukt, for eksempel, sammen med funksjoner som forteller deg hva som er nytt siden du sist besøkte vår nettside eller for å lagre dine personlige innstillinger. Når utløpsdatoen har passert vil denne typen cookie bli slettet når du returnerer til nettsiden som skapte den. Den andre typen cookie er en sesjonscookie, som er lagret midlertidig på minnet til datamaskinen mens du besøker vår nettside. Slike cookes blir for eksempel brukt til å lagre hvilket språk du bruker. Sesjonscookies forsvinner når du lukker nettleseren. Vi bruker også såkalte tredjeparts-cookies fra andre selskaper. Hvorfor bruker Mynewsdesk cookies? Vi bruker cookies for å følge og muliggjøre aktivitetene dine på nettsiden vår og for å optimalisere dens funksjonalitet. Cookies blir også brukt for å måle trafikk på nettsiden og for statistiske formål. Dette betyr at vi bruker cookies for å blant annet: la systemet gjenkjenne returnerende brukere og tilpasse navigasjonen og tjenestene, gjøre det enklere for deg å finne fram på nettsiden, for eksempel ved å tillate systemer som husker dine tidligere valg og la deg lagre favoritter og snarveier for programmer og tjenester, utvikle og forbedre nettsiden ved å forstå hvordan den blir brukt; og måle og rapportere antall brukere og trafikk. Vi bruker tredjeparts-cookies fra andre selskaper for å utføre markedsundersøkelser og trafikkmålinger og for å forbedre nettsidens funksjonalitet. Vi legger ved en liste og beskrivelse av hvilke cookies vi bruker. Denne listen kan bli oppdatert fra tid til annen fordi cookiesene vi bruker kan variere. Kan du forhindre bruken av cookies? Ved å bruke vår nettside samtykker du til bruken av cookies i henhold til Retningslinjene for Cookies. Dersom du ikke aksepterer bruken av cookies kan du skru av bruken i sikkerhetsinnstillingene til nettleseren din. Du kan også stille inn nettleseren slik at du mottar et spørsmål hver gang nettsiden vår forsøker å legge en cookie på datamaskinen din. Dersom nettleseren din støtter en såkalt inkognitomodus, kan du aktivere denne slik at alle cookies automatisk blir slettet hver gang du lukker nettleseren. Du kan når som helst slette cookies manuelt fra harddisken din. For mer informasjon om hvordan du kan tillate eller hindre cookies, viser vi til hjelpesidene til nettleseren din og til ec.europa.eu/ipg/basics/legal/cookies/index_en.htm eller www.aboutcookies.org. Den här webbläsaren löser det Klassiska tillverkaren lanserar elbil – första nya på 13 år Stockholmarnas slalombacke först som helt elektrifierad Premium Ny Teknik testar Apple Vision Pro: ”Otroligt – vilken pryl” Starlink tillåts – ska ge internet i Israel och Gaza Premium Experter: Batteriparksboomen kommer att ge jämnare elpriser Forskarnas lösning – så blir sol-till-vätgascellen stabil och effektiv Efter konkursen – Hövdings teknik sålt utomlands Facket vänder och lättar på blockaden – Teslabilar får repareras SJ-chefen: ”Svenska folket förtjänar att få åka tåg” Nytt förslag – sänkt a-kassa efter 100 dagar Premium Bygget stoppades mitt i – så här ser gigafabriken ut i dag Premium Lista: Elbilarna som laddar snabbast i vinterkyla – en sviker ”Skatteverkets agerande har skapat kaos – har gjort helt ny lagtolkning” Premium Experten: Då är it-bjässens förtroende förbrukat Se upp – så lätt kan man smygtitta i andras kameror Efter stora skandalen – KI klättrar på universitetsranking Ericsson ska leverera 5G till MSB – rullar ut i år Premium Framtidens kärnkraft har ett ryskt problem – nu måste väst agera Premium Så ska nya satelliter utmana radiomasterna på jorden Så många fick nya CSN-stödet: ”Inte beviljat så många som vi hade hoppats” Premium ”Ett decennium av elfordonsutveckling på väg att utraderas” Efter svåra it-attacken: Får lära sig använda fax NyTeknik Ny Teknik bevakar och skriver om ny teknik inom områden som fordons-industri, innovation, digitalisering, bygg, miljö, it och telekom. Ny Teknik skriver också om nya entreprenörer, life science, industrins utveckling och automatisering och hur tekniken förändrar samhället. Tidningen Ny Teknik riktar sig till ingenjörer, it-specialister, teknikkonsulter, forskare, beslutsfattare och allmänt teknikintresserade människor. Ny Tekniks mål är att hålla dessa personer uppdaterade med de senaste och viktigaste nyheterna, reportagen och trenderna inom teknikutveckling – både för jobbet och för fritiden Ny Teknik kommer ut på både webb och papper. På sajten nyteknik.se uppdaterar vi varje vardag med de snabbaste och mest pålitliga nyheterna och analyserna i teknik-Sverige. Att Ny Teknik skulle börja ges ut blev officiellt 17 maj 1967. Den 26 oktober samma år kom första numret ut. Tidningen är i dag en del av mediehuset Ny Teknik Group Sverige AB. Bland mediehuskollegerna finns Arbetarskydd, Lag & Avtal, och Teknikhistoria. Limitation of liability etc. Except for any legal responsibility that Mynewsdesk cannot exclude in law (such as mandatory product liability, personal injury or death), Mynewsdesk is not liable for loss of income, profits and savings, loss of contracts, loss of production, loss of goodwill, loss of data or other information, claims by third parties, consequential loss or any other indirect loss. For the avoidance of doubt, Mynewsdesk is not liable for damages related to, if applicable, Customer’s obligations to communicate investor related information due to applicable securities laws and stock exchange rules. Further, Mynewsdesk’s aggregate liability in any one calendar year shall not exceed the sum that Customer has paid Mynewsdesk during the same calendar year. Mynewsdesk is not liable for the permanent and uninterrupted availability of the Services or any other loss or outcome arising from any of the situations, including lack of accessibility and security, interruptions, risks and faults, referenced in Section 9. With regards to content, material or any third party services, Mynewsdesk does not guarantee that any content, material or service that is provided by third parties is correct, reliable, complete, accessible or lawful and Mynewsdesk is not liable for any damage or loss related to defects in such content, material or service. The Customer shall defend and indemnify Mynewsdesk for any claim, suit or proceeding brought against Mynewsdesk by any third party arising out of or connected to Customer’s use of the Services including claims related to Content published by the Customer within the Services. 13. Prices and payment The Customer shall pay compensation for the Services in accordance with the fees set out in the Order Form or otherwise agreed. Notwithstanding the above, Mynewsdesk may for each Renewal Period increase its fees with not more than ten (10) per cent unless Customer is provided with a notice of new pricing not less than 120 days prior the applicable Renewal Period. Payment shall, if not otherwise stated in the Order Form, be made in advance, against Mynewsdesk’s invoice or, if applicable, through use of a credit card. Payment must reach Mynewsdesk in full within stipulated payment term set out in the Order Form. If Customer should pay Mynewsdesk’s invoice late or fails to pay at all, Mynewsdesk may charge interest for late payment with an interest rate of eight (8) percent per annum, as well as reminder charges and compensation for any debt recovery costs, in addition to any other remedies Mynewsdesk may have. The Customer undertakes to make payment of invoices, in the currency stated on the invoice, to the account stated on the invoice. Without prejudice to its other rights, Mynewsdesk may temporarily disable the Customer’s access to the Services in the event the Customer has overdue payments in excess of twenty (20) days. In addition, Mynewsdesk may terminate the Main Agreement, delete and destroy the Customer’s Content in the event of overdue payments in excess of forty (40) days. In the event of early termination of the Main Agreement due to Customer’s breach the Customer shall not be entitled to a refund of any prepaid fees. 14. Force Majeure Neither party is responsible for faults or delay in the fulfilment of undertakings according to the Main Agreement if such faults or delays are caused by reasons or circumstances that cannot be controlled including, but not limited to, interruption or fault in the Internet or network, telecommunications, electricity supply or other infrastructure, general labour conflicts, war, fire, lightning strike, terrorist attack, DDoS attacks or similar attacks attempting to disrupt normal data traffic, changes in the regulations of the authorities or faults or delays in services from sub-contractors because of any of these circumstances. 15. Intellectual Property Rights All intellectual property rights relating to Mynewsdesk, Mynewsdesk’s Services, website and other related services, such as patents, design patents, design and pattern rights, copyright, neighbouring rights, moral rights, trade secrets and know-how, rights to databases, trademarks, company names, rights according to marketing legislation and all other intellectual property rights, in all cases regardless of whether registered or registrable, and all applications for registration of any of the above-named rights as well as the right to apply for these, and all rights and forms of protection of a similar character or that have a similar effect as these anywhere in the world, are and remain Mynewsdesk’s or Mynewsdesk’s licence providers’ property. Use of the Services does not in any way represent a transfer or assignment of such intellectual property rights to Customer. All Customer Content published through the Services by the Customer shall remain the sole property of the Customer or its respective legal owner. Any rights to Content produced by Mynewsdesk on behalf of the Customer as part of provided professional services shall also vest in Customer. 16. Confidentiality Both parties undertake to treat information that may be considered to be the other party’s business or trade secret (regardless of whether it is verbal, in writing, electronic or in some other form) as confidential, unless the party providing the information gives express written consent otherwise. This means that neither party may divulge such information to a third party or use such information for any purpose other than the fulfilment or implementation of the Main Agreement. Both parties must also ensure that any employees, agents or others that such information is revealed to follow this undertaking. This obligation of confidentiality applies for two (2) years after the Main Agreement has been terminated. The obligation of confidentiality does not however apply to information that is generally known or that a party can demonstrate that the party was aware of by some other means than through the Main Agreement. Neither does the obligation of confidentiality apply when a party is obliged to provide the information in accordance with law, regulations or the decisions of the authorities. 17. Messages Customer can contact Mynewsdesk by post to Mynewsdesk AB, Rosenlundsgatan 40, 118 53 Stockholm, or by e-mail to support@mynewsdesk.com. When Mynewsdesk needs to contact Customer, Mynewsdesk will use the postal address or e-mail address that Customer has provided in the Order Form. Customer is required to make sure that such contact information is updated. 18. Changes to the Terms and Conditions and the Main Agreement Mynewsdesk may change the General Terms and Conditions. The Customer shall be informed of such changes by e-mail, or through information being made available within the Services or on Mynewsdesk’s web site. Any changes come into force one (1) month after Mynewsdesk has, as set out above, informed Customer thereof. 19. Transfer of the Services The Main Agreement is valid between the parties and may not be assigned or transferred unless agreed in writing. However, Mynewsdesk may, in full or in part, transfer the provision of the Services to another company in the same group as Mynewsdesk. All rights and obligations that apply between Customer and Mynewsdesk will then instead apply between the Customer and the company that takes over the Services. 20. Applicable law and disputes The Main Agreement and the relationship between Customer you and Mynewsdesk will, unless otherwise stipulated in mandatory applicable law, be interpreted and applied in accordance with Swedish law (although with the exception of such international civil law provisions that involve the application of the law in any other jurisdiction). Disputes arising from the Main Agreement or the relationship between the parties will, unless otherwise stipulated in mandatory applicable law, be decided by the general courts, with Stockholm District Court as the first instance. Kontakta oss! Prova gratis 1 miljon journalistkontakter i den globala kontaktdatabasen 72% av Mynewsdesks kunder får pressmeddelanden återpublicerade 89 av 100 i domain rating på Mynewsdesk AI som hittar de mest relevanta journalisterna Hitta snabbt rätt kontakter med den AI-baserade funktionen Audience Targeting. Så fort du börjar skriva ett pressmeddelande som är längre än tusen tecken i plattformen kommer algoritmerna att identifiera journalister i Mynewsdesks databas som nyligen har skrivit om samma ämne. Du kan se deras namn, e-postadresser och potentiella räckvidd och kan direkt lägga till dem i listan över kontakter som ska få det aktuella utskicket. Kontakta oss Oslagbart nätverk globalt och lokalt Nå ut med ditt budskap till fler med hjälp av Mynewsdesks globala journalistnätverk och mediedatabas. Rikta dina kommunikationsinsatser mer träffsäkert genom lokala nätverk av journalister som aktivt valt att bevaka dina ämnesområden. Känn dig trygg med att alla kontakter hanteras i enlighet med GDPR. Boka ett möte! Riktad kommunikation med mätbar effekt Maximera effekten av dina insatser inom PR och kommunikation med rätt budskap till rätt målgrupp. Istället för breda massutskick kan du skapa nischade kontaktlistor utifrån olika ämnen och nå den mest relevanta målgruppen varje gång. Detaljerad statistik ger dig värdefulla insikter så att du kan fatta datadrivna beslut och optimera din kommunikation löpande. Få prisuppgift! Så här hanterar du dina kontakter Skapa distributionslistor med både befintliga kontakter och journalister från Mynewsdesks omfattande nätverk – allt i samma plattform. Skapa professionella utskick och rikta dem till specifika målgrupper utifrån ämne. Följ upp vilka utskick som skapar mest engagemang och se vilka kontakter som läser och delar ditt innehåll. Kontakta oss Maximera räckvidden med stark SEO Öka räckvidden hos din PR och kommunikation i sökresultaten med en av världens starkaste webbplatser. Som kund hos Mynewsdesk publicerar du ditt innehåll på en av världens starkaste domäner. Vår webbplats har mer än 42 miljoner länkar och en domain rating (DR) i klass med de mest kända varumärkena. Det gör att dina artiklar och pressmeddelanden har helt unika förutsättningar att ranka/synas betydligt högre upp på konkurrensutsatta sökord än om du bara hade publicerat dem på din egen hemsida. Läs mer om Mynewsdesk & SEO Effektiv PR med allt i samma plattform Genom att hantera dina kontakter i Mynewsdesks plattform kan du samla allt innehåll och alla aktiviteter kring PR och kommunikation på ett och samma ställe. Det sparar värdefull tid när du snabbt vill nå ut med ditt budskap. Boka demo – Vi kände att det definitivt var det bästa valet för oss med tanke på både den goda effekten och höga servicen som vi har mottagit. Vi är därför väldigt nöjda att vi gick tillbaka. Max Ansbro, Svenska bordtennisförbundet Läs kundcase Nå rätt kontakter – steg för steg Steg 1: Samla och sortera dina kontakter Ladda upp dina befintliga kontakter direkt till plattformen och komplettera med kontakter från Mynewsdesks medielistor och globala databas. Du kan enkelt sortera kontakter, flytta dem mellan olika listor och skapa nya kontaktlistor utifrån dina behov. Steg 2: Rikta varje utskick till rätt målgrupp Skapa proffsiga utskick och distribuera dem till relevanta kontaktlistor utifrån ämne. Genom riktad kommunikation bygger du upp långsiktiga relationer till journalister och andra kontakter, som ser dig som en trovärdig källa inom deras intresseområde. Steg 3: Mät och följ upp din kommunikation Utvärdera effekterna av varje utskick med detaljerad statistik. Se hur många som har öppnat, delat och interagerat med ditt innehåll. Identifiera dina mest engagerade kontakter och skicka påminnelser till dem som inte öppnat utskicken. Boka ett möte! Mynewsdesk erbjuder lösningar för: Skapa och publicera Läs mer Mediebevakning Läs mer Analys & Insikter Läs mer Contentbyrå Läs mer Frågor & svar Vad är Mynewsdesk? Mynewsdesk är en digital plattform som med hjälp av AI erbjuder dig en intelligent PR-lösning. Mynewsdesk hjälper företag och organisationer att bygga kännedom och skapa bättre relationer med journalister, opinionsbildare, kunder, influencers och andra relevanta målgrupper. Hur fungerar Mynewsdesk? Mynewsdesk ger företag och organisationer möjlighet att enkelt dela nyheter med över en miljon journalister världen över i vårt digitala nyhetsrum. Med hjälp av vårt analysverktyg får du detaljerade insikter om vilken räckvidd och medieexponering du får, och tillsammans med vårt verktyg för mediebevakning ser du vilket genomslag du får i media. Med Mynewsdesk kan du utvärdera dina insatser och arbeta för att maximera dina PR- och kommunikationsinsatser och nå ännu bättre resultat! Vilka använder Mynewsdesk? Företag och organisationer använder Mynewsdesk för att öka sin kännedom, och för att bygga relationer med journalister, opinionsbildare, kunder, influencers och andra relevanta målgrupper. Journalister, influencers och opinionsbildare använder Mynewsdesk för att skapa nyhetsbevakningar för ämnen som är relevanta för dem. Med Mynewsdesk kan de ta del av nyheter som de annars kunnat gå miste om. Vilka är fördelarna med Mynewsdesk? Mynewsdesks digitala nyhetsrum är allt du behöver för ditt PR- och kommunikationsarbete. Genom att samla all din externa kommunikation i en plattform, får du ett effektivt arbetsflöde med publicering, distribution, mediaövervakning, analys och en stark global mediedatabas med över en miljon journalistkontakter. Vi gör det enklare och mer effektivt för företag och organisationer att bygga relationer och kännedom om sin verksamhet. Vilken räckvidd erbjuder Mynewsdesk? Med vårt lokala nätverk på 29 000 journalister som prenumererar på nyheter från Mynewsdesk och vår globala mediedatabas når du över en miljon journalister världen över. Detta kombinerat med Mynewsdesks starka domän som ger dina publiceringar bättre placeringar i sökresultaten vilket ger dig en ökad synlighet. Vår lösning ger dig förutsättningar för att skapa den bästa och mest relevanta räckvidden för din kommunikation. Är Mynewsdesk gratis? För journalister och läsare är Mynewsdesk gratis. Som företag eller organisation har du möjlighet att testa Mynewsdesk gratis i tio dagar. När din testperiod är avslutad erbjuder vi dig olika upplägg som är skräddarsydda efter dina egna önskemål och behov. För priser och abonnemang, klicka här. Var hittar jag priser och abonnemang? Du hittar våra abonnemang här. För mer information om våra priser är du välkommen att kontakta vår säljavdelning här! Hur gör jag för att få ta del av en demo av Mynewsdesk? En demo av Mynewsdesk bokar du enkelt här! Hur kommer jag i kontakt med support och försäljning? Du är välkommen att kontakta oss här när som helst. Följ oss gärna på Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin och Instagram för mer information. Hur jobbar Mynewsdesk med AI? Mynewsdesks digitala PR-lösning är byggd med AI-teknik som automatiskt bevakar spridningen och prestationen av varje nyhet som du publicerar via Mynewsdesks presstjänst. AI möjliggör för dig att få reda på när dina nyheter plockas upp av media och vilka journalister som läser dina nyheter. Via AI-funktionen Audience Targeting analyserar Mynewsdesk också ditt innehåll för att sedan identifiera och ge förslag på relevanta journalister, influencers och medier som du borde kontakta, allt för att du ska få större förståelse för ditt PR-arbete, spara tid och kunna maximera dina resultat. Hur hanterar Mynewsdesk GDPR? Innan GDPR trädde i kraft uppdaterade Mynewsdesk våra Allmänna villkor i enlighet med den nya dataskyddsförordningen. Som kund ansvarar du själv för att de kontaktlistor du har i Contacts hanteras på ett lagligt sätt enligt GDPR. Det betyder att du som kund behöver definiera rutiner gällande era hanteringen av era kontaktlistor. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi hanterar GDPR här. Kom igång direkt Sätt upp ditt nyhetsrum på 10 minuter och få tillgång till 1 miljon kontakter. kreditrapporten.se/betalningsanmarkninga: :VGQH545: Vhita Tjänster MoM AB i konkurs | Kreditrapporten.se Sverige Stockholms län Stockholm Betalningsanmärkningar vecka 10 2023 Vhita Tjänster MoM AB 559061-4276 Bevaka detta företag Vhita Tjänster MoM AB (559061-4276) har blivit försatt i konkurs 2022-07-28. Bolaget har även efter konkursdatum fått inkomna betalningsanmärkningar. En kreditupplysning visar konkursförvaltare och kontaktinformation. Laddar betalningsanmärkningar... Vhita Tjänster MoM AB Organisationsnummer 559061-4276 Status Försatt i konkurs 2022-07-28 Bolagsform Aktiebolag Registrerad för F-skatt Nej Bransch 81210 - Lokalvård Antal anställda 0 anställda Registreringsdatum 2016-05-03 Aktivt sedan 2016-05-03 Bolagets säte Stockholms Kommun Aktiekapital 50 000 SEK Adresser Postadress C/O Hellström-Lundgren brännkyrkagatan 35 118 22 stockholm Verksamhetsbeskrivning "Hushållsnära tjänster till privata hushåll samt fastighetsservice till företag." Om företaget Vhita Tjänster MoM AB försattes i konkurs 2022-07-28. Det grundades 2016 och var verksamt inom branschen Lokalvård . Företaget var hemmavarande i Stockholm och hade enligt Bolagsverket 0 anställda. Vhita Tjänster MoM AB har företagsformen Aktiebolag och är inte registrerat för F-skatt. Företaget hade enligt senast inlämnade årsredovisning en omsättning på 2 845 000 kr och ett positivt resultat på 120 000 kr. All företagsdata i API Få all denna företagsinformation i Syna API Syna API är ett blixtsnabbt API där du kan hämta registrerade företagsuppgifter, betalningsanmärkningar, skatteuppgifter och mycket mer på alla Sveriges företag och personer. Kreditrapporten använder Syna API. Bli kund idag och kom igång direkt! Läs mer om Syna API Nyckeltal Samtliga nyckeltal anges i tusental kr. Oms. - Res. + Res. Vhita Tjänster MoM AB (559061-4276) Företaget har blivit försatt i konkurs. Om betalningsanmärkningen Kreditrapporten.se redovisar alla svenska aktiebolags betalningsanmärkningar. Det kan vara allt från en ansökan om betalningsföreläggande till en konkurs. Ett företag listas på kreditrapporten.se för att de fått minst en anmärkning de senaste 3 åren. Betalningsanmärkningar och händelser som gör att ett företag listas i Kreditrapporten.se Ansökan om betalningsföreläggande Betalningsföreläggande Företagsrekonstruktion Konkursansökan Konkurs Restfört skattekonto Tredskodom Ej betald tull/införselavgift Utmätningsförsök (misslyckat) Utmätningsförsök (ej tillgång) Återtagningsförsök Återtagning Bevaka Din ort Få mejl när ett företag fått en betalningsanmärkning eller gått i konkurs. Bevakningen är gratis. Bevaka Hur laddar jag ner min köpta kreditupplysning? När du genomfört ett köp genom att betala i kassan är din kreditupplysning tillgänglig för nedladdning direkt. Det finns flera sätt att nå rap... Läs mer Vad är en betalningsanmärkning? En betalningsanmärkning innebär att skulden inte var betald vid tidpunkten då den registrerades. Skulden kan därefter blivit betald. Det... Läs mer Vad är en kreditupplysning? Med kreditupplysning menas uppgifter, omdömen eller råd som lämnas till ledning för bedömning av någon annans kreditvärdighet eller vederhäfti... Läs mer Får bolaget i fråga reda på att jag har utfört en kreditupplysning på dem? Nej, Kreditrapporten skickar aldrig någon kopia eller information till ett företag när en kreditupplysning levereras.... certusvc.com/: :VGQH545: Certus - We Develop Good Ideas Into Great Businesses we develop good ideas into great businesses We utilize our core competencies in product and business development to help early-stage startups derisk and scale. We do this by placing ourselves in the driving seat next to the entrepreneurs. Read more Markus Enholm, General Partner We have many years of experience in developing hardware businesses. Anyone can outsource development of a product but not everyone understands the engineering, eco system and cultural complexities of doing business with a global supply chain as well as we do. What this means is that we are capable of developing businesses with a scalable cost structure without compromising on quality. Fredrik Lindberg, General Partner We make direct investments in startups utilizing our own capital. The benefits? It gives us the freedom and flexibility to act quickly on opportunities. In addition, we have a network of people that we like to call our global brain – consisting of top tier talents that we have handpicked in order to support the growth of our investees. Johan Nyberg, General Partner Our investment expertise has been sought after by more- established and mature companies, including global market leaders, that have co-invested with Certus on highly profitable joint-venture businesses. The access to product know-how, business knowledge and the right partners, is where the core competency of Certus resides. Anthony Grech, General Partner Our focus is not on statistical risk mitigation but value creation. Once we invest, we become fully committed and laser focused on seizing a company’s potential – meaning that we become involved in taking an idea from concept stage to a business. We look for self-aware entrepreneurs with high intellectual integrity that have a deep domain expertise and a proven channel to the market. Products enabled by Certus THE EVOKO LISO A world leading conference room booking product HUMLY Improves the office workplace experience with scalable technology NEW VENTURE A groundbreaking smart product soon to be launched Products enabled by Certus are sold in over Countries And have generated over Million USD in excess revenue. YOU CAN FIND PRODUCTS FROM THE BUSINESSES THAT WE’VE ENABLED ALL OVER THE WORLD HERE’S A SELECTION OF COMPANIES USING THEM We’ve gathered a network we like to call our global brain The global brain allows us to help ventures attract talent, brand and sourcing partners as well as to innovate on a worldwide level. Betalningsanmärkningar och händelser som gör att ett företag listas i Kreditrapporten.se Ansökan om betalningsföreläggande Betalningsföreläggande Företagsrekonstruktion Konkursansökan Konkurs Restfört skattekonto Tredskodom Ej betald tull/införselavgift Utmätningsförsök (misslyckat) Utmätningsförsök (ej tillgång) Återtagningsförsök Återtagning Bevaka Din ort Få mejl när ett företag fått en betalningsanmärkning eller gått i konkurs. Bevakningen är gratis. Bevaka Hur laddar jag ner min köpta kreditupplysning? När du genomfört ett köp genom att betala i kassan är din kreditupplysning tillgänglig för nedladdning direkt. Det finns flera sätt att nå rap... Läs mer Vad är en betalningsanmärkning? En betalningsanmärkning innebär att skulden inte var betald vid tidpunkten då den registrerades. Skulden kan därefter blivit betald. Det... Läs mer Vad är en kreditupplysning? Med kreditupplysning menas uppgifter, omdömen eller råd som lämnas till ledning för bedömning av någon annans kreditvärdighet eller vederhäfti... Läs mer Får bolaget i fråga reda på att jag har utfört en kreditupplysning på dem? Nej, Kreditrapporten skickar aldrig någon kopia eller information till ett företag när en kreditupplysning levereras....
